result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheyenne F Meshigaud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
12:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cheyenne F Meshigaud appeared by video. Case called appearances given.  Not a victim rights case.  Deft wants to proceed with the preliminary hearing without an attorney.  Court advises the deft as to her rights to an attorney.  Court finds the deft is making the decision to proceed without an attorney for this hearing.  State calls Officer Christine Doering duly sworn and testifies. Id'd the deft on the ZOOM video. Direct by the State.  No cross by the deft.  Court finds probable cause.  Court will not go to arraignment at this time.
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety. Shall not consume or possess alny controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Kurt B. Zengler appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Attorney Kurt B. Zengler appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. .  Case called appearances given.  Reading of the complaint not waived.  Attorney rights are advised.  Time limits for the preliminary hearing are not waived  Bond set
